item.description: Podcast Description Anything Goes with James English Ep/94 Glenn Tamplin tells his story.¬†The Essex millionaire, who made his fortune in steel, wants to use his remarkable life story to help everyone, from the homeless to drug addicts and former Premier League youngsters, whatever their ambitions may be.¬†Tamplin is driven by an extraordinary experience he had three years ago, when he says he met God. item.title: Britain‚Äôs longest serving transgender prisoner tells all. | Anything Goes with James English
item.description: Podcast Description Anything goes with James English Ep/92.¬†Sarah Jane Baker, Britain‚Äôs longest serving transgender tells her story. Sarah has just recently been released after serving 30 years in prison. Sarah was imprisoned for kidnapping and torturing her stepmother’s brother and then given a life sentence for the attempted murder of another prisoner. Sarah grew up on the tough streets of London and when she was a child, her father lost a business, and after that, the abuse started.

item.title: The Boy in the cellar Stephen Smith tells his heartbreaking story | Anything Goes with James English
item.description: Podcast Description Anything goes with James English Ep/91.¬†Stephen Smith is the boy who did not exist. Born out of wedlock in the early 1960s, Steve’s parents hid him away from the world by locking him in the cellar…for thirteen years. Starved and beaten, the little boy’s world was a darkened room that measured just eight feet by ten with a single makeshift bed, bare light bulb, and a solitary table.

item.title: Asian gangster Chet Sandhu - Part 2 | Anything Goes with James English
item.description: Podcast Description Anything goes with James English Ep/89¬†Part 2 with Chet Sandhu.¬†AN INTERNATIONAL drug smuggler who landed a jail sentence in one of Europe‚Äôs toughest prisons.¬†Chet Sandhu, from Hartlepool, made vast amounts of money selling steroids and Valium by smuggling the substances in from Pakistan.¬†But in November 1999, the doorman was arrested at gunpoint in Alicante Airport in connection with a 2 million pound haul, the largest seizure of black market steroids in Spanish history.

item.title: Shot 27 time and survived - Manchester gang member Darryl Laycock tells his story | Anything Goes with James English
item.description: Podcast Description Darryl Laycock tells his story. Darryl Laycock was lucky to survive one of the most violent periods in Manchester’s criminal history. After being shot over 20 times and spending half his life behind bars, Darryl has now dedicated the rest of it to keeping others off the same path he took when he was younger. Darryl grew up in Moss Side in the seventies and eighties, in a house where his dad battered his mum.

item.title: Newcastle gangster Stephen Sayers tells his story | Anything Goes with James English
item.description: Podcast Description The story of tough man Stephen Sayers Coming from a huge close-knit family of street traders long before it was legalised, Stephen Sayers spent his early years on the barrows, witnessing constant brushes with the law. Aunties and uncles were frequently incarcerated and a hatred and distrust of authority swelled within the younger members of the family. The scene was set. Standing alongside his brothers and cousins in vicious street fights and feuds with rival gangs, they’ve been linked to multi-million pound armed robberies, extortion, unsolved gangland murders and protection rackets.

item.title: Millionaire Marine to Addicted to Crystal Meth - Chris Thrall tells his story | Anything Goes with James English
item.description: Podcast Description James English, the Anything Goes show Ep85.¬†Chris Thrall left the Royal Marines to pursue a business venture in Hong Kong.¬†The entrepreneur hoped to develop his marketing company that he set up while he was in the Forces.¬†But while he had plans to become a multi millionaire, the veteran ended up addicted to crystal meth and was left homeless.¬†This is the rise and fall of Chris Thrall.

item.description: Podcast Description James English, The Anything Goes Show Ep78. Neil ‚ÄòSam‚Äô Samworth spent eleven years working as a prison officer in HMP Manchester, aka Strangeways.
